document.discussion_title: Andy Murray sees his unbeaten run come to an end as Marin Cilic wins Cincinnati Masters in straight sets
document.topic_text: Search Andy Murray sees his unbeaten run come to an end as Marin Cilic wins Cincinnati Masters in straight sets OLYMPIC champion Andy Murray’s career-best unbeaten run ended on 22 matches last night when he went down 6-4 7-5 to Marin Cilic in the final of the Cincinnati Masters. Just a week after retaining his Olympic title in Brazil, the 29-year-old Scot was beaten in an hour and 34 minutes by his 27-year-old rival. World No.2 Murray was attempting to secure his third Cincinnati Masters title after wins in 2008 and 2011. But he was second best to the Croat who took his first title of 2016 and his third since the US Open in 2014. Murray, whose 50th win of the year had come in the semi-final against... read more Related news Andy Murray books place in Cincinnati final with straight sets win over Wimbledon finalist Milos Raonic Andy Murray celebrated his 50th win of the year as he reached the final of the Western & Southern Open with a 6-3 6-3 defeat of Milos Raonic in Cincinnati. In a rematch between this year's Wimbledon finalists, Murray, who won that showdown for a... Daily Mail , yesterday, 10:11 in Sport Andy Murray's winning run halted at 22 in Cincinnati final Andy Murray's long winning streak has ended with defeat to Marin Cilic in the final of the Western and Southern Open in Cincinnati. The 6-4 7-5 loss brought to an end a 22-game run - the longest undefeated stretch of the Scot's career - and was... Belper News , yesterday, 23:21 in Sport Andy Murray has now won 22 games in a row after reaching Cincinnati Masters final Andy Murray extended his unbeaten run to an incredible 22 matches and with it reached the final of the Cincinnati Masters last night. The Scot, still fresh from his Rio 2016 heroics, came up against the man he beat to win this year’s Wimbledon title,... Metro , yesterday, 12:46 in Sport Andy Murray and Rafa Nadal keep hopes of Olympic glory alive with easy wins in Rio The defending Olympic champion hardly broke sweat in beating the Argentinian 6-3 6-1. He will now face Italy’s Fabio Fognini or Benoit Paire of France in the third round. Murray, 29, who lifted the Wimbledon and Queens titles this year, has won his... Daily Express , 9 August 2016 in Sport Serena Williams sees Rio Olympics dream come to an end in shock defeat All hopes Serena Williams had of winning a medal at the Rio Olympics are over after a shock defeat to Elina Svitolina of the Ukraine. World number one Serena was the favourite for gold but having been knocked out of the doubles alongside sister Venus... Metro , 10 August 2016 in Sport Andy Murray survives scare to beat Steve Johnson in three sets and reach Olympic Games semi-finals Andy Murray kept his hopes of a second Olympic gold medal alive after beating Steve Johnson in three sets to reach the semi-finals. The British No 1 took the first set 6-0 but was pegged back by the American, losing the second 6-4 to ensure a... Daily Mail , 12 August 2016 in Sport
